column5: I don't do panfish...this is my friends and I found the colors to be so bright they threw me off...
Looks like an Atlantic to be honest.
yes and yes.  Sunfish and pumkinseed can be used interchageably.  Well I do anyway.
but yeah its a pimpkinseed and a big one at that
thanks guys. this can be deleted
That's a hog Pumpkinseed for sure how long was it Richard
Looks to me like some I've seen down near Findlay Ohio in flooded quarries.  JF
I caught one like that where pigeon lake meets buckhorn,and wondered myself.Mine looked more like a sunfish weighing in at just over 1 1/2 pnds.
Pumpkinseed, which is a type of sunfish.
It really is a gorgeous fish though . . . nice catch!
It's a pumpkinseed--- AKA--- bait stealin---hook swallowin----fin stickin---pain in da backside

LMAO, came across a guy fishing at a pond I was going to fish at and he had a bucket full of them. Look at all the rainbow trout I caught! Should be a species test before you fish? I have heard them called sunfish or pumpkinseeds, and that one is larger than normal. They tend to run a lot smaller in size than Bluegills.
